burlap.oomdp.stochasticgames.common

Class UniversalSingleAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.oomdp.stochasticgames.SingleAction
      • burlap.oomdp.stochasticgames.common.UniversalSingleAction

  • public class UniversalSingleAction
extends SingleAction
    This SingleAction definition defines an action with a given name and parameters that can be executed in every state by every agent. This is a useful action definition for symmetric stage games.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class burlap.oomdp.stochasticgames.SingleAction

        actionName, domain, parameterOrderGroups, parameterTypes

      UniversalSingleAction(SGDomain d, java.lang.String name)
      Initializes this single action to be for the given domain and with the given name.
      UniversalSingleAction(SGDomain d, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String[] types)
      Initializes this single action to be for the given domain, with the given name, and with the given parameter class types.
      UniversalSingleAction(SGDomain d, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String[] types, java.lang.String[] parameterOrderGroups)
      Initializes this single action to be for the given domain, with the given name, with the given parameter class types, and with the given parameter order groups.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UniversalSingleAction

        public UniversalSingleAction(SGDomain d,
                     java.lang.String name)
        Initializes this single action to be for the given domain and with the given name. This action is automatically added to the given domain
        Parameters:
        d - the domain to which this action belongs
        name - the name of this action

      • UniversalSingleAction

        public UniversalSingleAction(SGDomain d,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String[] types)
        Initializes this single action to be for the given domain, with the given name, and with the given parameter class types. This action is automatically added to the given domain
        Parameters:
        d - the domain to which this action belongs
        name - the name of this action
        types - the object class names for the possible parameters of this action.

      • UniversalSingleAction

        public UniversalSingleAction(SGDomain d,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String[] types,
                     java.lang.String[] parameterOrderGroups)
        Initializes this single action to be for the given domain, with the given name, with the given parameter class types, and with the given parameter order groups. This action is automatically added to the given domain
        Parameters:
        d - the domain to which this action belongs
        name - the name of this action
        types - the object class names for the possible parameters of this action.
        parameterOrderGroups - the parameter order groups to use

    • Method Detail

      • isApplicableInState

        public boolean isApplicableInState(State s,
                          java.lang.String actingAgent,
                          java.lang.String[] params)
        Description copied from class: SingleAction
        Returns true if this action can be applied in the given state by the given agent with the given parameters.
        Specified by:
        isApplicableInState in class SingleAction
        Parameters:
        s - the state in which the action would be executed.
        actingAgent - the agent who would be executing the action
        params - the parameters applied
        Returns:
        true if this action can be executed; false otherwise.
